properties.Name: Earthquake Park
properties.Comments: Learn about previous earthquakes affecting Alaska, some great views of the city, and some shorter leisurely hikes.

properties.Name: Bear Tooth Grill & Theatrepub
properties.Comments: There is a Grill (Mexican cuisine) and Theatrepub (pizza). They are seperate restaurants, but equally as good in taste. The beer is delicious. Highly recommended.

properties.Name: Far North Bicentennial Park
properties.Comments: Excellent hiking trails from beginners to advanced. Do be wary as there are many areas where bears feed on salmon while in season.

properties.Name: Denali Flightseeing Route
properties.Comments: Once in a lifetime experience. A must for any visitor.

properties.Name: Denali Glacial Landing
properties.Comments: Once in a lifetime experience. A must for any visitor.

properties.Name: Talkeetna Roadhouse
properties.Comments: Delicious breakfast food at an extremely reasonable price. Come hungry, and expect large quantities of food on your plate.

properties.Name: Denali Park Tour
properties.Comments: Arrive later in the season to go further on the Park Road with tour buses. Note: Private vehicles can only travel 15 miles in.

properties.Name: Lynx Creek Pizza
properties.Comments: Decent pizza locale near the Denali Park entrance.

properties.Name: Denali Viewpoint South
properties.Comments: Amazing view of Denali National Park and Denali.

properties.Name: Flattop Mountain
properties.Comments: Great views of Anchorage, and an 'easy' day hike.

properties.Name: Potter Marsh Bird Sanctuary
properties.Comments: Mile 117: A wooden boardwalk winds through the marsh and across watery openings and sedges, perfect habitat for a rich variety of birds.

properties.Name: Beluga Point
properties.Comments: Mile 110: A rocky outpost jutting into the waters of Turnagain Arm. It’s named for the white whales that are often spotted from this location as they make their way up and down the inlet.

properties.Name: Alaska Wildlife Conservation Center
properties.Comments: Mile 79: See Alaskan wildlife up close! The Alaska Wildlife Conservation Center is dedicated to conservation, education, and quality animal care of Alaska’s wildlife.

properties.Name: Chair 5
properties.Comments: Amazing American cuisine (including local specialties) for a good price. Highly recommended!

properties.Name: Kenai Fjords National Park Tour
properties.Comments: Book the National Park Tour with Fox Island dinner (Wild Alaska Salmon, Prime Rib, and Alaskan King Crab).

properties.Name: Fox Island
properties.Comments: Enjoy the amazing cuisine (Wild Alaska Salmon, Prime Rib, and Alaskan King Crab), skip rocks on the beach, and enjoy the beauty around you.

properties.Name: Hive Island
properties.Comments: See countless birds species, called the hive due to the sounds heard (similar to a bee hive for birds).

properties.Name: Bear Glacier
properties.Comments: Bear Glacier is one of the premier, jaw-dropping scenic experiences on the coast of Alaska. Bear Glacier lagoon has the some of the most massive icebergs in Alaska.

properties.Name: No Name Island
properties.Comments: Check out the Steller Lions taking in the Sun's rays.

properties.Name: Holgate Glacier
properties.Comments: A tidewater and mountain glacier. It is one of the smaller glaciers in Aialik Bay, but a popular destination to hear and see glacial calving.

properties.Name: Pederson Glacier
properties.Comments: Pedersen Glacier eceded throughout the 20th century exposing Pedersen Spit and Pedersen Lagoon that includes a beautiful habitat.

properties.Name: Aialik Glacier
properties.Comments: The largest glacier in Aialik Bay, and both a tidewater and mountain glacier. While fairly stable, the glacier calves most actively in May and June.

properties.Name: Exit Glacier
properties.Comments: One of the most accessible valley glaciers in Alaska with moderately easy trails to view the glacier up close. A visible indicator of glacial recession due to anthropogenic climate change.

properties.Name: Seward Brewing Company
properties.Comments: Grab a brew (or flight) and some local fresh cuisine! Recently remodeled, and a great updated menu! Great souvenirs glasses!

properties.Name: Alaska Sealife Center
properties.Comments: Alaska’s only public aquarium and ocean wildlife rescue center. Experience close encounters with puffins, octopus, sea lions and other sealife while peeking over the shoulders of ocean scientists studying Alaska’s rich seas and diverse sealife.

properties.Name: St. Elias Brewery
properties.Comments: Local brewery with decent cuisine. The decor is... different.

properties.Name: Kay Bay Coffee
properties.Comments: BEST. COFFEE. EVER!

properties.Name: Duncan House Diner
properties.Comments: Great breakfast food served all day for a reasonable price. Cute decor!

properties.Name: Alaska Islands & Ocean Visitor Center
properties.Comments: Your window to the largest seabird refuge in the world, with all of the wonders of Kachemak Bay right outside its doors!

properties.Name: Mariner Park
properties.Comments: Cute beach park located at the start of the Homer Spit.

properties.Name: Lands End
properties.Comments: The end of Alaska Highway 1. Great views of Kachemak Bay.

properties.Name: Skyline Drive
properties.Comments: Incredible views of Kachemak Bay, Homer, and the Homer Spit.

properties.Name: The Saltry
properties.Comments: Amazing local cuisine. Order the Halibut, and Cheesecake for dessert. You won't be disappointed.

properties.Name: Lighthouse
properties.Comments: Hike to a cute lighthouse on Halibut Cove. You can also view the arch from up close!

properties.Name: Danny J Boat Cruise
properties.Comments: Take the 45-minute cruise to Halibut Cove via the Danny J. Booking will include a dinner reservation at the amazing Saltry restaurant.

properties.Name: Halibut Cove Hiking Trail
properties.Comments: Short trail to Halibut Cove's lighthouse, great views of the Bay.

properties.Name: Salty Dawg Saloon
properties.Comments: A well-known landmark with a lot of history and tradition. Bring a dollar bill to leave your mark on the walls, and check out the USGS marker inside the front door (the only one known in a bar).

properties.Name: The Bagel Shop
properties.Comments: Super delicious fresh bagels. Get a bagel, make a sandwich, or do a schmear.

properties.Name: Homer Overlook
properties.Comments: Amazing views of Homer.

properties.Name: Anchor Point Beach
properties.Comments: Great views of the Cook Inlet volcanoes.

properties.Name: North America's Most Westerly Highway Point
properties.Comments: Check out the most Westerly locale along North America's Highway system.

properties.Name: The Transfiguration of Our Lord Russian Orthodox Church
properties.Comments: A beautiful historic Russian Orthodox church that opened in 1901.

properties.Name: Kenai Lake Overlook
properties.Comments: An unofficial overlook, there is a path that leads to an opening with amazing views of Kenai Lake.

properties.Name: Anton Anderson Memorial Tunnel
properties.Comments: The longest railroad highway tunnel in North America.

properties.Name: Bird Point and Trail
properties.Comments: Mile 99: Stunning views. Also, look for Beluga whales a few hours before high tide.

properties.Name: Alaska Zoo
properties.Comments: Lots of great local animals!

properties.Name: Hotel Lancelot
properties.Comments: View of the Colosseo from the room!

properties.Name: Spanish Steps
properties.Comments: A set of steps climbing a steep slope between the Piazza di Spagna (base) and Trinità dei Monti Church (top).

properties.Name: Trevi Fountain
properties.Comments: The largest Baroque fountain in Rome and one of the most famous fountains in the world.

properties.Name: Pantheon
properties.Comments: Built in 118–128 AD, and one of the best-preserved of all Ancient Roman buildings.

properties.Name: Arco di Tito
properties.Comments: An honorific arch located in the Roman Forum. Constructed in 82 AD, by Emperor Domitaian shortly after the death of his older brother Titus to commemorate Titus' victories.

properties.Name: Santi Cosma e Damiano
properties.Comments: The circular building was once at the entrance onto the Forum (not used today) built in the early 4th century as a Roman temple. The best example of doors, made out of Bronze in the Roman Forum.

properties.Name: Casa delle Vestali
properties.Comments: The residence of Vestal Virgins, located in the Roman Forum.

properties.Name: Tempio di Antonio Faustina
properties.Comments: The temple was built in 141 AD by Emperor Pius and dedicated to his deceased and deified wife, Faustina the Elder. When Pius was deified after his death in 161 AD, the temple was re-dedicated jointly to Antoninus and Faustina at the instigation of his successor, Marcus Aurelius.

properties.Name: Colosseo
properties.Comments: Built in 80 AD of concrete and sand, and it is the largest amphitheatre ever built.

properties.Name: Colosseo: Underground
properties.Comments: The original floor was comprised of wood covered by sand (the Latin word for sand is arena), covering an elaborate underground structure called the hypogeum (underground).

properties.Name: Colosseo: From Above
properties.Comments: The crowd capacity made it essential that the venue could be filled/evacuated. Architects adopted solutions, still used today, to ensure visitors could get in, and out swiftly.

properties.Name: Arco di Costantino
properties.Comments: Rome's largest triumphal arch, erected by the Roman Senate to commemorate Constantine I's victory over Maxentius at the Battle of Milvian Bridge in 312 AD.

properties.Name: Circo Massimo
properties.Comments: An ancient Roman chariot racing stadium and mass entertainment venue that accomodated 150,000 spectators.

properties.Name: Aventine Hill
properties.Comments: The southernmost of Rome's seven hills.

properties.Name: Giardino degli Aranci
properties.Comments: Secluded public square with fragrant orange trees, medieval walls & views over the city & Tiber River.

properties.Name: Knights of Malta Keyhole
properties.Comments: W-O-W-! Peek through this keyhole on a piazza designed by Piranesi in 1765, and you will see a garden path that ends with bushes perfectly framing the dome of St. Peter's in the distance.

properties.Name: Map Gallery
properties.Comments: O.M.G. Maps!

properties.Name: Sistine Chapel
properties.Comments: Breathtaking. Photos and talking are prohibited in the Chapel.

properties.Name: Basilica di San Pietro
properties.Comments: Breathtaking. Largest Christian Basilica in the world. If you climb the Cupola, halfway up you will see this shot.

properties.Name: St. Peter Cupola
properties.Comments: Breathtaking views! A MUST while traveling to Vatican City. There is a cost (€5) to scale the 551 steps to the top that go through narrow passages. There is a lift that will save 320 steps (€7).

properties.Name: Aqueduct Park
properties.Comments: A public park in the city limits. The park is named after the aqueducts that go through it, including Aqua Felix, part of Aqua Claudia, and the remains of Villa delle Vignacce.

properties.Name: Historic Vatican Entrance
properties.Comments: The original public entrance to Vatican City.

properties.Name: Cortile della Biblioteca
properties.Comments: Beautiful statues!

properties.Name: Bramante Staircase
properties.Comments: 'The original' Bramante staircase built in 1505 to a design by Donato Bramante. It was built to allow Pope Julius II to enter his private residence while still in his carriage.

properties.Name: Fontana della Galera nei Giardini Vaticani
properties.Comments: The fountain was created as a replica of a Galleon of the Papal Fleet by famed architect Hans Van Zanten.

properties.Name: Tomba di San Pietro
properties.Comments: Tombs of the Popes (located underneath the Basilica). Photos and talking are prohibited in the Tomb.

properties.Name: Directional Plaque in Piazza San Pietro
properties.Comments: The northeast directional plaque adjacent to the obelisk in St. Peter's Square.

properties.Name: Hotel Alessandra
properties.Comments: View from the hotel room!

properties.Name: Ponte Vecchio
properties.Comments: A Medieval stone arch bridge over the Arno River. Noted for still having shops built along it, as was once common. Fish butchers initially occupied the shops until Florence royalty enforced tenants to be high-end jewelers.

properties.Name: Museo Galileo
properties.Comments: Home to one of the world’s major collection of scientific instruments.

properties.Name: Caffe Alfieri
properties.Comments: Amazing wine bar right off the Arno River. The bar will provide apps when you order drinks. HIGHLY recommended!

properties.Name: Galleria dell'Accademia
properties.Comments: An art museum housing Michelangelo's sculpture David. It also has other works by Michelangelo and a collection of Renaissance paintings.

properties.Name: Battistero di San Giovanni
properties.Comments: The Baptistery is one of the oldest buildings in Florence, constructed between 1059 and 1128.

properties.Name: Bronze Doors: Battistero di San Giovanni
properties.Comments: The Baptistry is renowned for its three sets of artistically important bronze doors with relief sculptures.

properties.Name: Cattedrale di Santa Maria del Fiore
properties.Comments: It took 140 years to construct finishing in 1436, without the facade. In 1887 the facade, which includes Italy's green and red colors, was finally finished after Florence became Italy's capitol (for 5 years).

properties.Name: Venchi Gelato
properties.Comments: Florence is the birthplace of Gelato, and Venchi Gelato is to die for. Visit, and pay the extra euro for chocolate with your gelato. You will not be dissapointed.

properties.Name: Porcellino
properties.Comments: Local Florentine nickname for the bronze fountain of a boar. Visitors put a coin into the mouth, hoping it will fall through without hitting the underlying grate. Successfully doing so indicates good luck.

properties.Name: Benvenuto Cellini's Perseus with the Head of Medusa
properties.Comments: Located in the Loggia dei Lanzi, a building on a corner of the Piazza della Signoria.

properties.Name: Ponte della Costituzione
properties.Comments: The fourth bridge over the Grand Canal, designed by Santiago Calatrava. It was moved into place in 2007, amid protest by politicians and the general public.

properties.Name: Hotel Moresco
properties.Comments: View from the hotel room!

properties.Name: Piazza San Marco
properties.Comments: The main public square of the city. All other urban spaces in the city are called 'campi'.

properties.Name: Palazzo Ducale
properties.Comments: A palace built in Venetian Gothic style, and the former residence of the Doge of Venice, the supreme authority of the former Republic of Venice.

properties.Name: Torre dell'Orologio
properties.Comments: The Clock Tower is an early renaissance building in the Piazza San Marco at the entrance to the Merceria.

properties.Name: Ponte dei Sospiri
properties.Comments: Translates to the 'Bridge of Sighs' in English. An arched bridge named for the sighs of prisoners crossing it en route from the Palazzo Ducale to the prison cells.

properties.Name: Corte Seconda del Milion
properties.Comments: The neighborhood where Marco Polo grew up.

properties.Name: Ponte di Rialto
properties.Comments: The Rialto Bridge is one of the four bridges spanning the Grand Canal. It is the oldest bridge across the canal, built in the 16th century, and is the dividing line for the San Marco and San Polo districts.

properties.Name: Monumento a Bartolomeo Colleoni
properties.Comments: Verrocchio, Bartolomeo Colleoni, Campo Santi Giovanni e Paolo a Venezia opposite La Scuola Grande di San Marco.

properties.Name: Ponte dell’Accademia
properties.Comments: One of the four bridges crossing the Grand Canal. First constructed in the 1850's it was made of steel; a couple decades later the bridge was built again with wood.

properties.Name: Impronta Cafe
properties.Comments: AMAZING contemporary dishes in the heart of Venice. HIGHLY recommended!

properties.Name: Campanile
properties.Comments: Bell tower of St. Mark's Basilica in Piazza San Marco. Galileo first demonstrated his telescope to Doge, Antonio Priuli in 1609 from the Campanile. Amazing views of the Piazza, and Venice!

properties.Name: Gondola Ride
properties.Comments: A MUST while visiting Venice.

properties.Name: Vineyards
properties.Comments: A view from Trenitalia between Florence, and Rome.

properties.Name: Hotel Forum
properties.Comments: View of the hotel courtyard with Sfusato lemon trees!

properties.Name: Scavi di Pompei
properties.Comments: Archaeological site of the remains of the iconic Roman city preserved by Vesuvius' ash.

properties.Name: Hilton Sorrento Palace
properties.Comments: View from the room!

properties.Name: Waterfall
properties.Comments: Beautiful waterfall off the Sorrento coast.

properties.Name: Capri Cruise
properties.Comments: View of Capri from the boat!

properties.Name: Grotta Bianca
properties.Comments: White incrustations on its sides, and white stalagtites hanging from the roof. Locals believe some of the rock resembles the Virgin Mary.

properties.Name: Faraglioni
properties.Comments: Coastal and oceanic rock formations eroded by waves.

properties.Name: Grotta Verde
properties.Comments: Absolutely *stunning* water color. A MUST if traveling to Capri.

properties.Name: Punta Carena
properties.Comments: Italy's second most important lighthouse, active since 1867.

properties.Name: Funicular
properties.Comments: The public transit of Capri residents.

properties.Name: Funicular Top
properties.Comments: Great views of the Marina Grande, and Capri.

properties.Name: Garden of Augustus
properties.Comments: Botanical gardens designed in terraces overlooking the sea, with many ornamental plants and flowers.

properties.Name: Gelateria Buonocore
properties.Comments: Delicious gelato.
